oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Continuous choreographies as limiting solutions of the $n$-body problem
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Reynaldo, Castaneira Ramírez
Pablo, Padilla Longoria
Héctor, Sánchez Morgado
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Dynamical Systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper we consider the $n$-body problem with equal masses and ($-\sigma$)-homogeneous potential, $0<\sigma\leq1$ , when $n\longrightarrow +\infty$. We first derive an integro-differential equation that the solutions must satisfy. Then we show that choreographic solutions in the limit correspond to travelling waves of this equation, which turns out to be the Euler-Lagrange equation of a corresponding limiting functional. We can then prove the existence of solutions for this type of problem, which we call continuous choreographies, using a variational approach. In particular, we show that the circle is a {\em continuous choreography} on the plane for $0<\sigma<1$, but the circle is not the minimun of the functional of action.
